title: Learning Objective 3.1
stimulusHtml:
Students identify a work of art.

0-1 point

Accurately identifies the major historical event that occurred in the time between the creation of these two works that brought about differences in how time is presented in the two works.
descriptions: Does not accurately identify the major historical event that occurred in the time between the creation of these two works that brought about differences in how time is presented in the two works.
Accurately identifies the major historical event that occurred in the time between the creation of these two works that brought about differences in how time is presented in the two works.

title: Learning Objective 3.1
stimulusHtml:
Students identify a work of art.

0-1 point

Accurately identifies the audience for the Calendar Stone.
descriptions: Does not accurately identify the audience for the Calendar Stone.
Accurately identifies the audience for the Calendar Stone.

title: Learning Objective 3.1
stimulusHtml:
Students identify a work of art.

0-1 point

Accurately identifies the audience for the Codex Mendoza.
descriptions: Does not accurately identify the audience for the Codex Mendoza.
Accurately identifies the audience for the Codex Mendoza.

title: Learning Objective 3.5
stimulusHtml:
Students analyze relationships between works of art based on their similarities and differences.

0-1 point

Accurately uses specific visual evidence to compare how time is presented in each work.
descriptions: Does not accurately use specific visual evidence to compare how time is presented in each work.
Accurately uses specific visual evidence to compare how time is presented in each work.

title: Learning Objective 3.5
stimulusHtml:
Students analyze relationships between works of art based on their similarities and differences.

0-1 point

Accurately uses specific contextual evidence to compare how time is presented in each work.
descriptions: Does not accurately use specific contextual evidence to compare how time is presented in each work.
Accurately uses specific contextual evidence to compare how time is presented in each work.
